children.value: In this exercise we had to:
Add additional useful operators for the AutoDiff class
Add some more functions (cos, exp, log, …) for the AutoDiff class.
Evaluate and plot Legendre-polynomials up to order 5, in the interval

children.html: −1≤x≤1-1 \le x \le 1−1≤x≤1

children.value: . Evaluate and plot also their derivatives (using AutoDiff).

children.value: In the code the implementation is:
Evaluate and plot Legendre-polynomials (and their derivatives) up to order 5, in the interval

children.html: −1≤x≤1-1 \le x \le 1−1≤x≤1

children.label: Evaluate and plot Legendre-polynomials (and their derivatives) up to order 5, in the interval -1 \le x \le 1 (subtask 3)

children.html: −1≤x≤1-1 \le x \le 1−1≤x≤1

children.value: the Legendre-polynomials up to order 5 and their derivatives (using AutoDiff). For the plot, it generates a
file that can be plotted using
The Legendre polynomials are defined using the following recursive form:

children.html: P0=1P1=xPk(x)=(2k−1)xPk−1(x)−(k−1)Pk−2(x)k,k≥2\begin{aligned} P_{0} = 1 \\ P_{1} = x \\ P_{k}(x) = \frac{(2k - 1)xP_{k-1}(x) - (k - 1)P_{k-2}(x)}{k}, \qquad k \ge 2 \end{aligned}P0​=1P1​=xPk​(x)=k(2k−1)xPk−1​(x)−(k−1)Pk−2​(x)​,k≥2​
P, P′P, \, P'P,P′
xxx
[−1,1][-1,1][−1,1]

children.value:
. So it computes the values of the Legendre polynomials, and the values of their derivatives for each point.
Then the program writes the results into the
x, \quad P_0, \quad P_{0}', \quad P_1, \quad P_{1}', \quad P_2, \quad P_{2}', \quad P_3, \quad P_{3}', \quad P_4, \quad P_{4}', \quad P_5, \quad P_{5}'
children.html: x,P0,P0′,P1,P1′,P2,P2′,P3,P3′,P4,P4′,P5,P5′x, \quad P_0, \quad P_{0}', \quad P_1, \quad P_{1}', \quad P_2, \quad P_{2}', \quad P_3, \quad P_{3}', \quad P_4, \quad P_{4}', \quad P_5, \quad P_{5}'x,P0​,P0′​,P1​,P1′​,P2​,P2′​,P3​,P3′​,P4​,P4′​,P5​,P5′​
